title: Follow structured reapply procedure for work branch changes
description: Coordinate the resync and replay flow so the retired work branch commits are reproduced on a fresh head without manual diff copying.
workflow: Complete the resync-baseline task to create branch reapply/aci-entities-layout from the canonical main head.
Apply the saved work-branch patch and resolve any path updates introduced since the original commit, keeping yggdrasil.json at the repo root.
Split the resulting changes into focused commits covering entity governance moves, module/library realignment, and audit runner updates.
Update issues.md and task status fields once each scoped commit has merged on the new branch.
acceptance_criteria: Resync and patch tasks are marked complete with documented validation runs.
Follow-up commits exist on the new branch for governance moves, module moves, and audit updates.
Audit log reflects the completion of each step without reopening the deprecated work branch.
notes: Use the tasks/README.md format for any future additions to this queue.
If additional commits are needed beyond the captured patch, extend the workflow with new subtasks referencing their patches.
resolution_notes: Replay procedure executed: binder retirement, governance relocation, module realignment committed and logged.
